page.title: 12PARWICH CONSERVATION AREAS
page.content: The school first started to conserve the two areas in the village in 1983 and has improved the sites no end. The "cave" was one area which at one time was used to keep lost animals and later as a tip. The other area was the "corner" which was once used as a butcher's tip. First of all we cleared these areas of litter including old food wrappers and broken bottles. This was done with the help of people from the Conservation Action Project. The stream was then cleared and some of the nettles removed. Nestboxes for birds were set up and some young trees were planted. A bridge was also made for the "cave" area. Every month from the beginning of the year, the 3rd and 4th years went to the cave and corner and kept a diary recording the growth of trees, ground cover and minibeasts.
